Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: k3d
Description: K3d is a lightweight wrapper to run k3s in Docker

Arguments.Name: --agents-memory
Arguments.Description: Memory limit imposed on the agents nodes

Arguments.Name: --api-port
Arguments.Description: Specify the Kubernetes API server port exposed on the LoadBalancer

Arguments.Name: -c
Arguments.Description: Path of a config file to use

Arguments.Name: --gpus
Arguments.Description: GPU devices to add to the cluster node containers

Arguments.Name: --host-pid-mode
Arguments.Description: Enable host pid mode of server(s) and agent(s)

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Specify k3s image that you want to use for the nodes

Arguments.Name: --k3s-arg
Arguments.Description: Additional args passed to k3s command

Arguments.Name: --kubeconfig-switch-context
Arguments.Description: Directly switch the default kubeconfig's current-context to the new cluster's context (requires --kubeconfig-update-default) (default true)

Arguments.Name: --kubeconfig-update-default
Arguments.Description: Directly update the default kubeconfig with the new cluster's context (default true)

Arguments.Name: --lb-config-override
Arguments.Description: Use dotted YAML path syntax to override nginx loadbalancer settings

Arguments.Name: --network
Arguments.Description: Specify the docker network to use

Arguments.Name: --no-image-volume
Arguments.Description: Don't create a volume for the container's root filesystem

Arguments.Name: --no-lb
Arguments.Description: Don't create a loadbalancer for the cluster

Arguments.Name: --no-rollback
Arguments.Description: Don't rollback changes if cluster creation failed

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Map ports from the node containers (via the serverlb) to the host

Arguments.Name: --registry-config
Arguments.Description: Specify path to an extra registries.yaml file

Arguments.Name: --registry-create
Arguments.Description: Create a k3d-managed registry and connect it to the cluster (Format: NAME[:HOST][:HOSTPORT] - Example: `k3d cluster create --registry-create mycluster-registry

Arguments.Name: --registry-use
Arguments.Description: Connect to one or more k3d-managed registries running locally

Arguments.Name: --runtime-label
Arguments.Description: Add label to container runtime (Format: KEY[=VALUE][@NODEFILTER[;NODEFILTER...]] - Example: `k3d cluster create --agents 2 --runtime-label "my.label@agent:0,1" --runtime-label "other.label=somevalue@server:0"`

Arguments.Name: -s
Arguments.Description: Specify how many servers you want to create

Arguments.Name: --servers-memory
Arguments.Description: Memory limit imposed on the server nodes [From docker]

Arguments.Name: --subnet
Arguments.Description: [Experimental: IPAM] Define a subnet for the newly created container network

Arguments.Name: --timeout
Arguments.Description: Rollback changes if cluster couldn't be created in specified duration

Arguments.Name: --token
Arguments.Description: Specify a cluster token. By default, we generate one

Arguments.Name: --wait
Arguments.Description: Wait for the server(s) to be ready before returning

Arguments.Name: -c
Arguments.Description: Path of a config file to use

Arguments.Name: --port-add
Arguments.Description: Map ports from the node containers

Arguments.Name: --timeout
Arguments.Description: Maximum waiting time for '--wait' before canceling/returning

Arguments.Name: --wait
Arguments.Description: Wait for the server(s) (and loadbalancer) to be ready before returning

Arguments.Name: migrate
Arguments.Description: Migrate a config file to the latest version

Arguments.Name: import
Arguments.Description: Import image(s) from docker into k3d cluster(s)

Arguments.Name: -k
Arguments.Description: Do not delete the tarball containing the saved images from the shared volume

Arguments.Name: -t
Arguments.Description: Do not delete the tools node after import

Arguments.Name: merge
Arguments.Description: Write/Merge kubeconfig(s) from cluster(s) into new or existing kubeconfig/file

Arguments.Name: -d
Arguments.Description: Merge into the default kubeconfig ($KUBECONFIG or /Users/balli/.kube/config)

Arguments.Name: --overwrite
Arguments.Description: [Careful!] Overwrite existing file, ignoring its contents

Arguments.Name: -u
Arguments.Description: Update conflicting fields in existing kubeconfig (default true)

Arguments.Name: -c
Arguments.Description: Cluster URL or k3d cluster name to connect to. (default "k3s-default")

Arguments.Name: --k3s-node-label
Arguments.Description: Specify k3s node labels in format

Arguments.Name: --memory
Arguments.Description: Memory limit for the node container

Arguments.Name: --timeout
Arguments.Description: Maximum waiting time for '--wait' before canceling/returning

Arguments.Name: --wait
Arguments.Description: Wait for the node(s) to be ready before returning

Arguments.Name: --port-add
Arguments.Description: Map ports from the node container to the host

Arguments.Name: --default-network
Arguments.Description: Specify the network connected to the registry (default "bridge")

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Specify image used for the registry (default "docker.io/library/registry:2")

Arguments.Name: --no-help
Arguments.Description: Disable the help text (How-To use the registry)

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Select which port the registry should be listening on your machine (localhost) (Format: [HOST:]HOSTPORT)

Arguments.Name: --proxy-password
Arguments.Description: Specify the password of the proxied remote registry

Arguments.Name: --proxy-remote-url
Arguments.Description: Specify the url of the proxied remote registry

Arguments.Name: --proxy-username
Arguments.Description: Specify the username of the proxied remote registry

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Mount volumes into the registry node (Format: [SOURCE:]DEST

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: Show k3d and default k3s version
